title: O'er the Atlantic;
author: W[hyte], W[illiam] E.
snippet: A few remarks about the great Victoria Bridge e'er I take my leave of Montreal, and I will accompany the reader farther up the river St.

title: Black's picturesque tourist of Scotland.
snippet: Having undergone, however, repeated enlargements to adapt it to the increasing traffic, it was at length pulled down, and on its site the Victoria Bridge of five arches, faced with white granite, and having a roadway sixty feet wide, has been erected.

title: Benedict's wanderings, in Ireland, Scotland, Italy and Sicily ...
author: Dawson, Edward W[alter] [from old catalog]
snippet: At the foot of Stockwell street is Victoria Bridge,

title: Sparks from a Locomotive; or Life and Liberty in Europe. By the author of “Belle Brittan's Letters.” [The dedication signed, H. F., i.e. H. Fuller.]
author: F., H.
snippet: A few evenings since, the famous" Victoria Bridge" across the St. Lawrence, atMontreal, was added ; and a private view, followed
